Package zoo

Class Habitat

java.lang.Object
zoo.Habitat
public class Habitat extends Object
Class representing a habitat grid in the zoo. Each habitat has a type for each row and can house animals based on their compatibility.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Habitat(int cols, String[] habitatTypes)
    Constructs a Habitat with the specified number of columns and habitat types for each row.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    String
    displayGrid()
    Returns a string representation of the habitat grid for visualization.
    Animal
    getAnimal(int row, int col)
    Retrieves the animal at the specified row and column.
    boolean
    placeAnimal(Animal animal)
    Places an animal in the first available spot in its compatible habitat (going row by row), if the animal is not already in the grid.
    boolean
    placeAnimalAt(Animal animal, int row, int col)
    Places an animal at a specified row and column if the cell is valid (not out of bounds), compatible, and the animal is not already in the grid.
    boolean
    removeAnimal(Animal animal)
    Removes an animal from the specified row and column if it exists in the grid.

  • Constructor Details

    • Habitat

      public Habitat(int cols, String[] habitatTypes)
      Constructs a Habitat with the specified number of columns and habitat types for each row.

      Note: Any exception message is fine, but it should clearly describe the reason for the exception (e.g., Habitat types cannot be null or empty." or "cols should be 1 or more").
      Parameters:
      cols - the number of columns in the habitat grid. Should be 1 or more
      habitatTypes - a 1D array specifying the habitat type for each row. Cannot be null or empty.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if habitatTypes is null/empty or if cols is less than 1

  • Method Details

    • placeAnimal

      public boolean placeAnimal(Animal animal)
      Places an animal in the first available spot in its compatible habitat (going row by row), if the animal is not already in the grid.
      Parameters:
      animal - the animal to place.
      Returns:
      true if the animal was placed successfully, false otherwise.

    • placeAnimalAt

      public boolean placeAnimalAt(Animal animal, int row, int col)
      Places an animal at a specified row and column if the cell is valid (not out of bounds), compatible, and the animal is not already in the grid.
      Parameters:
      animal - the animal to place.
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      Returns:
      true if the animal was placed successfully, false otherwise.

    • removeAnimal

      public boolean removeAnimal(Animal animal)
      Removes an animal from the specified row and column if it exists in the grid.
      Parameters:
      animal - the animal to remove.
      Returns:
      true if the animal was removed, false otherwise.

    • getAnimal

      public Animal getAnimal(int row, int col)
      Retrieves the animal at the specified row and column.
      Parameters:
      row - the row index.
      col - the column index.
      Returns:
      the animal at the specified position (might be null), or null if out of bounds parameters

    • displayGrid

      public String displayGrid()
      Returns a string representation of the habitat grid for visualization. Print each row as a 1-D array with \n at the end
      Returns:
      the string representation of the habitat grid.
